title: 1910 T100 Honest Tobacco Silhouttes Baseball none higher SGC 60 Roger Bresnahan SOLD
author: Republicaninmass

posts.post_title: 1910 T100 Honest Tobacco Silhouttes Baseball none higher SGC 60 Roger Bresnahan SOLD
posts.post_content:
A must for type card enthusiasts, catcher or Bresnahan collectors! 

Just look at the "Hannibal Lecter" mask! 

From the auction listing
Graded EX 60 by SGC. Extremely rare sample card from one of the T100 "Silhouettes" set. Issued in 1910 by the Honest Tobacco Company, this set features silhouette images of various characters and professions (bartender, plumber, fireman, fisherman, policeman, waiter, etc.). Among the fifty cards in the set, five cards feature sports figures (baseball, football, boxing, golf, and bowling). The card measures 2.25 x 3.25 inches and pictures a catcher facing left waiting to catch the ball. While the player is not identified, the catcher has the Giants' "NY" insignia on his shoulder, which could allow for a theoretical identification as Bresnahan. We have seen non-sport examples from this set, but this is the first example of the baseball player in the set we have ever encountered. This is certainly a very unusual and interesting sample card rarity. 

now $500/BO



[IMG]http://i.ebayimg.com/images/g/KskAAOSwq5pXPkWk/s-l1600.jpg[/IMG]


[IMG]http://i.ebayimg.com/images/g/pBoAAOSwEOxXPkWo/s-l1600.jpg[/IMG]

These cards are super rare. I have one from the set .... the Golf card. It would grade between a 4 or a 5 but being in England I am not that too bothered about grading which is probably a mistake but hayho
